subject: Re: [junit] continuous testing
msgSnippet: ... If the code had not changed in months , can you give us more insight on the boundary condition.   You must have passed the month boundary before -- is it
messageBody:
At 12/1/2005 11:58 AM, you wrote:
> > So we found an edge case, like the "year 2000" issue, where code can
> > fail due to the passage of time, not just changes to the code.
>
>This sounds like a good case for mocking up the system clock. See
>http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?VirtualClock.
>
> ------------------
> Paolo Perrotta
> Bologna, Italy

If the code had not changed "in months", can you give us more insight
on the boundary condition. You must have passed the month boundary
before -- is it because the end of year is approaching?

In any case, you'll have one more test to run soon ;-)

-Rob


Rob Biedenharn <Rob_Biedenharn@...>
